1977 Inaugural Committee

Dear Friend:

The Inauguration of Jimmy Carter as the 39th President of the
United States has now passed into history. But many Americans
still treasure the memory of that three-day period both as a
highlight of their own personal lives and as a milestone in our
nation's history. January 20, 1977, has become, for them, the
birthdate of what Jimmy Carter has called "a new spirit in this
country."

Perhaps the most memorable of the many special events that marked
the Inauguration was the Gala Concert of January 19, performed on
the stage of the Kennedy Center Opera House and televised to some
fifty-seven million viewers throughout the world. This unprecedented
program was not only a gesture of welcome to the President-elect
but was also an expression of solidarity from Americans of
many political persuasions.

This Gala Concert is now being made available by CBS Records in a
deluxe record-and-booklet album, proceeds from which will be donated
to the National Endowment for the Arts. In 1977 alone this
agency will distribute a total of eighty-five million dollars to
American arts organizations, communities and artists.

As Co-Chairpersons of the 1977 Presidential Inaugural Committee,
we cordially invite you to relive your enjoyment of President
Carter's Inauguration through this unusual album. In addition
to owning a unique sight-and-sound document of a treasured moment
in history, you will also be actively aiding the arts and artists
who preserve and foster the rich tradition of our nation's cultural
heritage.

Sincerely,
Bardyl R. Tirana
Co-Chairperson

Vicki Rogers
Co-Chairperson
